description: Fitness-related activity designed for a specific health-related purpose, including defined exercise routines as well as activity prescribed by a clinician.
title: ExercisePlan

educationalUse.description: The purpose of a work in the context of education; for example, 'assignment', 'group work'.

code.description: A medical code for the entity, taken from a controlled vocabulary or ontology such as ICD-9, DiseasesDB, MeSH, SNOMED-CT, RxNorm, etc.

producer.description: The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, tv/radio series etc.).

text.description: The textual content of this CreativeWork.

alternativeHeadline.description: A secondary title of the CreativeWork.

accountablePerson.description: Specifies the Person that is legally accountable for the CreativeWork.

keywords.description: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.

character.description: Fictional person connected with a creative work.

contentRating.description: Official rating of a piece of content—for example,'MPAA PG-13'.

offers.description: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

publishingPrinciples.description: Link to page describing the editorial principles of the organization primarily responsible for the creation of the CreativeWork.

exerciseType.description: Type(s) of exercise or activity, such as strength training, flexibility training, aerobics, cardiac rehabilitation, etc.

repetitions.description: Number of times one should repeat the activity.

dateCreated.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

pathophysiology.description: Changes in the normal mechanical, physical, and biochemical functions that are associated with this activity or condition.

potentialAction.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

publisherImprint.description: The publishing division which published the comic.

workload.description: Quantitative measure of the physiologic output of the exercise; also referred to as energy expenditure.

associatedMedia.description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for encoding.

audience.description: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

accessibilityControl.description: Identifies input methods that are sufficient to fully control the described resource (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

indication.description: A factor that indicates use of this therapy for treatment and/or prevention of a condition, symptom, etc. For therapies such as drugs, indications can include both officially-approved indications as well as off-label uses. These can be distinguished by using the ApprovedIndication subtype of MedicalIndication.

translationOfWork.description: The work that this work has been translated from. e.g. 物种起源 is a translationOf “On the Origin of Species”

copyrightYear.description: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.

creator.description: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

restPeriods.description: How often one should break from the activity.

commentCount.description: The number of comments this CreativeWork (e.g. Article, Question or Answer) has received. This is most applicable to works published in Web sites with commenting system; additional comments may exist elsewhere.

contributor.description: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork.

intensity.description: Quantitative measure gauging the degree of force involved in the exercise, for example, heartbeats per minute. May include the velocity of the movement.

typicalAgeRange.description: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

fileFormat.description: Media type (aka MIME format, see IANA site) of the content e.g. application/zip of a SoftwareApplication binary. In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, 'encoding' can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular fileFormat information.

category.description: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

discussionUrl.description: A link to the page containing the comments of the CreativeWork.

activityFrequency.description: How often one should engage in the activity.

version.description: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.

locationCreated.description: The location where the CreativeWork was created, which may not be the same as the location depicted in the CreativeWork.

provider.description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

isPartOf.description: Indicates a CreativeWork that this CreativeWork is (in some sense) part of.

accessibilityHazard.description: A characteristic of the described resource that is physiologically dangerous to some users. Related to WCAG 2.0 guideline 2.3 (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

duplicateTherapy.description: A therapy that duplicates or overlaps this one.

activityDuration.description: Length of time to engage in the activity.

educationalAlignment.description: An alignment to an established educational framework.

epidemiology.description: The characteristics of associated patients, such as age, gender, race etc.

awards.description: Awards won by or for this item.

genre.description: Genre of the creative work or group.

publisher.description: The publisher of the creative work.

about.description: The subject matter of the content.

license.description: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

workExample.description: Example/instance/realization/derivation of the concept of this creative work. eg. The paperback edition, first edition, or eBook.

study.description: A medical study or trial related to this entity.

medicineSystem.description: The system of medicine that includes this MedicalEntity, for example 'evidence-based', 'homeopathic', 'chiropractic', etc.

mentions.description: Indicates that the CreativeWork contains a reference to, but is not necessarily about a concept.

isBasedOnUrl.description: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

encoding.description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for associatedMedia.

sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.

image.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

adverseOutcome.description: A possible complication and/or side effect of this therapy. If it is known that an adverse outcome is serious (resulting in death, disability, or permanent damage; requiring hospitalization; or is otherwise life-threatening or requires immediate medical attention), tag it as a seriouseAdverseOutcome instead.

aggregateRating.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

associatedAnatomy.description: The anatomy of the underlying organ system or structures associated with this entity.

thumbnailUrl.description: A thumbnail image relevant to the Thing.

mainEntity.description: Indicates the primary entity described in some page or other CreativeWork.

schemaVersion.description: Indicates (by URL or string) a particular version of a schema used in some CreativeWork. For example, a document could declare a schemaVersion using a URL such as http://schema.org/version/2.0/ if precise indication of schema version was required by some application.

accessibilityFeature.description: Content features of the resource, such as accessible media, alternatives and supported enhancements for accessibility (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

interactivityType.description: The predominant mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are 'active', 'expositive', or 'mixed'.

publication.description: A publication event associated with the item.

relevantSpecialty.description: If applicable, a medical specialty in which this entity is relevant.

seriousAdverseOutcome.description: A possible serious complication and/or serious side effect of this therapy. Serious adverse outcomes include those that are life-threatening; result in death, disability, or permanent damage; require hospitalization or prolong existing hospitalization; cause congenital anomalies or birth defects; or jeopardize the patient and may require medical or surgical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes in this definition.

guideline.description: A medical guideline related to this entity.

exampleOfWork.description: A creative work that this work is an example/instance/realization/derivation of.

editor.description: Specifies the Person who edited the CreativeWork.

mainEntityOfPage.description:
Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described.

See background notes for details.

recordedAt.description: The Event where the CreativeWork was recorded. The CreativeWork may capture all or part of the event.

hasPart.description: Indicates a CreativeWork that is (in some sense) a part of this CreativeWork.

additionalVariable.description: Any additional component of the exercise prescription that may need to be articulated to the patient. This may include the order of exercises, the number of repetitions of movement, quantitative distance, progressions over time, etc.

award.description: An award won by or for this item.

copyrightHolder.description: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.

accessibilityAPI.description: Indicates that the resource is compatible with the referenced accessibility API (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

learningResourceType.description: The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.

sourceOrganization.description: The Organization on whose behalf the creator was working.

inLanguage.description: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard.

citation.description: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

encodings.description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork.

recognizingAuthority.description: If applicable, the organization that officially recognizes this entity as part of its endorsed system of medicine.

additionalType.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

author.description: The author of this content. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

dateModified.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

interactionStatistic.description: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication. The most specific child type of InteractionCounter should be used.

description.description: A short description of the item.

releasedEvent.description: The place and time the release was issued, expressed as a PublicationEvent.

translator.description: An agent responsible for rendering a translated work from a source work

contentLocation.description: The location depicted or described in the content. For example, the location in a photograph or painting.

timeRequired.description: Approximate or typical time it takes to work with or through this learning resource for the typical intended target audience, e.g. 'P30M', 'P1H25M'.

workTranslation.description: A work that is a translation of the content of this work. e.g. 西遊記 has an English workTranslation “Journey to the West”,a German workTranslation “Monkeys Pilgerfahrt” and a Vietnamese  translation Tây du ký bình khảo.

isFamilyFriendly.description: Indicates whether this content is family friendly.

position.description: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.
